IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH THROUGH THE TRAINING OF LEADERS IN THE CHURCH OF JESUS CHRIST, EMPOWERING THE POOR, AND NETWORKING EXISTING CHRISTIAN MINISTRIES FOR THE GREATER EFFECTIVENESS OF ALL.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH THROUGH THE TRAINING OF LEADERS IN THE CHURCH OF JESUS CHRIST, EMPOWERING THE POOR, AND NETWORKING EXISTING CHRISTIAN MINISTRIES FOR THE GREATER EFFECTIVENESS OF ALL.
IRS990.Desc: Training/Teaching/Mentoring-Ongoing leadership coaching of the CCCT leadership impacting a denomination of approx. 6,500 people-Ongoing training of indigenous Maasai cross-cultural missionary couple going to unreached peoples of the Swahili Coast-Ongoing discipleship of individuals in unreached communities-Training and sponsorship of 5 pastors, 1 former Bishop and 2 missionaries of the CCCT churches in missions theology through the Kairos course in Arusha and Tabora-Oversight of the Maware church in Morogoro of approx. 120 congregants-Training of 20 Youth with A Mission missionaries in training on Godly Relationships in Inikaret impacting through their ministries approx. 200 people-Ongoing upper management training of 3 Tanzanians in project overseeing , human resourcing, accounting and organizational leadership-Ongoing one on one prayer and counseling of existing and emerging leaders throught time period-Training 27 CCCT pastors in small outreach groups training impacting congregants numbering approx. 3,105-Training 27 CCCT pastors in Becoming a Sending Church impacting congregants numbering approx. 3,105-Engaging and sponsoring consultant advising CCCT leadership on Member Based Organization formation to fund the national church office and missions-2 day leadership seminar for 22 CCCT pastors and leaders in Loliondo, Ngorongoro District impacting approx. 2,500 congregants-Two co-mentoring camping trips with international Christian leaders-Ongoing bi-monthly co-mentoring meetings-Formation and oversight of the National Missions Strategy Committee of CCCT churches as they formulate the official missions strategy of the denomination of approx. 6,500 members-Providing leadership and consultation in the planting of a house church movement in Arusha, Tanzania-Ongoing one on one spiritual formation coaching with various leaders and emerging leadersOutreach-5 trips into unreached areas of the Swahili Coast-4 impact trips to one creative access community resulting in strategic relationships being built-Sponsored former Bishop of CCCT and the lead Intercessor of CCCT to travel to the Maware Church in Morogoro to lead a seminar of approx. 250 people with a causal sequence impacting 1,250 people-Small Outreach Groups training on Swahili Coast-Keynote speakers for Talanta African Football Academy in Naivasha, Kenyas Spiritual Emphasis Weekend (30 young women football players aged 12-22)-Donor vision trip and 7 year assessment of water project in Enguewa, Longido District (This project was installed in 2016. The project continues to bring the first clean water to a population of approx. 2,000 people reducing significantly water borne diseases especially among children).-Initial survey and donor engagement for a new water project slated to provide water for 2,500 people in Mlangarini, Arusha DistrictPrayer and Retreat Facilitation-Facilitation and staffing on the Wild Hope Retreat/Training Center of approx. 44 key Christian leaders throughout the time period in personal prayer retreat impacting through their minsitries approx. 26,400 people-Facilitation and staffing on the Wild Hope Retreat/Training Center of 12 groups from other Christian organizations in their spiritual and ministerial objectives impacting through their ministries approx. 69,700 people-Hosting two senior families in senior national leadership of the FPCT denomination for prayer and retreat-Hosting two Chrisitan medical teams for refreshment and vision casting; focusing in Ethiopia and India respectively-Hosting children at risk short term missionariesEducational Stimulation-Ongoing mentoring, and leadership coaching of the Enduata Christian Primary School Manager impacting 5 teachers, 70 students and approx. 60 families-Ongoing assessment and evaluation of the Enduata Christian Primary School-Ongoing financial support of 5 teachers and 1 manager of the Enduatra Christian Primary School-Completed the construction of the 3rd and 4th classroom of the Enduata Christian Primary School-Provided tuition scholarships for 3 primary school students-Provided tuition scholarships for 4 secondary school students-Provided tuition scholarships for 7 university school students-Provided tuition scholarship for one CCCT pastor for completion of his diploma in Theology at Arusha University-4 day Living in the Light discipleship seminar for 12 sponsored secondary and university students-Raised capital and offered business training for an Agro-Vet in Longido, District as he begins his services thereOther-Drought assessment in Longido district and facilitation together with Christian Missionary Fellowship of International Disaster Emergency Services (ides.org) drought assistance in Longido with a budget of $40,000 providing emergency feeding of 880 families representing approx.. 4,000 people-Hosting of Easter Sunrise Service for 6 local churches and other ministry leaders-Hosting representatives from Ghana in their endeavor to establish a like minded ministry there called Wild Rain Ghana

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A PDF COPY OF 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO EACH BOARD MEMBER VIA EMAIL WHO THEN REVIEWS AND APPROVES BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors ensures that all trustees, officers, agents, employees, and independent contractors of the organization are made aware of the organization's policy with respect to conflicts of interest. Each director signs an annual reporting statement certifying they have reviewed the conflict of interest policy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Compensation Review Committee (CRC) annually reviews the performance of the Wild Hope International CEO and other highly compensated employees. Without influence from the CEO or other highly compensated employees, the CRC evaluates performance, collects comparable data regarding compensation for these positions and, after a decision is made, documents the process for consideration and approval of the compensation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Compensation Review Committee (CRC) annually reviews the performance of the Wild Hope International CEO and other highly compensated employees. Without influence from the CEO or other highly compensated employees, the CRC evaluates performance, collects comparable data regarding compensation for these positions and, after a decision is made, documents the process for consideration and approval of the compensation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Where the governing documents (articles of incorporation, bylaws, and constitution) and conflict of interest policy of Wild Hope International (WHI) are subject to the Federal public disclosure rules (or state public disclosure rules), these documents will be made publicly available as applicable law may require, upon request. Otherwise, the governing documents and conflict of interest policy will be provided to the public at the discretion of the Board of Directors of WHI.
